creditline: The Friends of Bruce B. Dayton Art Acquisition Fund
medium: Pastel on blue-gray wove paper, faded to tan, mounted on board
provenance: Alexandre Dumas (1802–1872); by descent, Château du Monte-Cristo, Le Port-Marly, France. [M. Minot, Paris, until 1977; sold to Shepherd]; [Shepherd Gallery, New York, 1977–2021]. [Ben Elwes Fine Art, London, 2021]
text: The oval portrait bust depicts a man in his mid-40s. He has dark curly thick hair, tousled and cut above the ears, dark eyebrows, pursed lips, a small chin, and an intense gaze. He is in three-quarters view, revealing to the spectator that his right ear is pierced and he wears a small glittering earring--perhaps a silver ball or pearl. He wears a simple white shirt and black jacket, and is depicted against a beige background.
title: Portrait of Alexandre Dumas Père
